body:
- v0.2.0
- Vim 8.0 works well.
- macOS Sierra 10.12.5 (16F73)
- iTerm2 v3.0.15
- `$TERM`: screen-256color

### Actual behaviour
When I start neovim by `nvim`, it prints an error message which is `E576: Error while reading ShaDa file: there is an item at position 270498 that must not be there: Missing items are for internal uses only`. But it works well before, I don't known what caused this.

### Expected behaviour

Start without printing any error message.

### Steps to reproduce using `nvim -u NORC`

```
# It has the same problem.
nvim -u NORC
```

### Similar issue

#6652 
#4108

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3297602/27000720-f163b290-4dea-11e7-9944-f30f52cf34c8.png)

comment_data.body:
With `nvim -u NONE -V`, it prints:

```
$ nvim -u NONE -V
Reading ShaDa file "/Users/kevin/.local/share/nvim/shada/main.shada" info marks oldfiles
E576: Error while reading ShaDa file: there is an item at position 270498 that must not be there: Missing items are for internal uses only
Press ENTER or type command to continue^C
```

So I removed `/Users/kevin/.local/share/nvim/shada/main.shada`. It works well. It's weird, anyway, I can use neovim again.

I got this error with
```
nvim +term
```

However it doesn't happen every time.

**Version**
```
NVIM v0.2.2
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.0.4
Compilation: /usr/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -g -O2 -fPIE -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -DDISABLE_LOG -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -Wconversion -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1 -DNVIM_UNIBI_HAS_VAR_FROM -O2 -g -DMIN_LOG_LEVEL=3 -Og -g -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wvla -fstack-protector-strong -fdiagnostics-color=auto -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -D_GNU_SOURCE -I/build/neovim-HJnLxJ/neovim-0.2.2/build/config -I/build/neovim-HJnLxJ/neovim-0.2.2/src -I/usr/include -I/usr/include -I/usr/include -I/usr/include -I/usr/include -I/usr/include -I/usr/include -I/build/neovim-HJnLxJ/neovim-0.2.2/build/src/nvim/auto -I/build/neovim-HJnLxJ/neovim-0.2.2/build/include
Compiled by pkg-vim-maintainers@lists.alioth.debian.org

Features: +acl +iconv +jemalloc +tui
See ":help feature-compile"

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "/usr/share/nvim"

Run :checkhealth for more info
```
happened to me today, nothing in my flow changed and yet it happened after opening neovim 9355351754th time ..."solution" above works tho

Can confirm, I'm seeing the same issue. Might be a newly introduced bug? I built from source at fb52790d1c16afdd12e4e484ee1dbce8d2a161b9 and a commit that modifies man.vim but is surely unrelated.

```
$ nvim --version                    
NVIM v0.5.0-866-g339ca766f
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
Compilation: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/cc -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1 -O2 -g -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wmissing-prototypes -Wimplicit-fallthrough -Wvla -fstack-protector-strong -fno-common -fdiagnostics-color=always -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -D_GNU_SOURCE -DNVIM_MSGPACK_HAS_FLOAT32 -DNVIM_UNIBI_HAS_VAR_FROM -DMIN_LOG_LEVEL=3 -I/Users/nhooyr/src/neovim/neovim/build/config -I/Users/nhooyr/src/neovim/neovim/src -I/Users/nhooyr/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX11.0.sdk/usr/include -I/usr/local/opt/gettext/include -I/Users/nhooyr/src/neovim/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto -I/Users/nhooyr/src/neovim/neovim/build/include
Compiled by nhooyr@ien.local

Features: +acl +iconv +tui
See ":help feature-compile"

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "/usr/local/share/nvim"

Run :checkhealth for more info
```

I solved this issue by deleting all viminfo files in my ~/local/share/vim directory 

``` rm ~/local/share/vim/viminfo*```
local/share is my XDG_DATA_HOME so
```rm $XDG_DATA_HOME/vim/viminfo*```
is probably the more universal fix

I had three files in ~/.local/share/nvim/shada:
- main.shada
- main.shada.tmp.a
- main.shada.tmp.b

I removed all of them and neovim recreated main.shada on first launch. The error disappeared after this.
For any other tortured souls running nvim on windows, the path for the shada may be `$env:LOCALAPPDATA\nvim-data\shada\`

This has happened to me just now, fixed it same as above by deleting shada folder:

`rm -rf ~/.local/share/nvim/shada` or `rm -rf $HOME/.local/share/nvim/shada` in case your tilde expansion isn't working nice.

Does anyone know what causes this or just unlucky?
Note: macOS Monterey 12.6 ^ (latest update as of the above post)
I'm on ArchLinux and still get this pretty frequently after updates, I just have to delete the shada files every time.
Reopening as this doesn't seem to be solved.

For anyone coming across this thread who removed `~/.local/share/nvim/shada` and still got this error message, I found that I also had shada files in `~/.local/state/nvim/shada`. Removing those files got rid of the error messages.

Still having this issue despite removing ~/.local/share/nvim/shada ,   and placing 

```
" change default viminfo file locatoin
if !has('nvim') | set viminfo+=n~/.config/vim/viminfo | endif

```
in my viminfo.

it happened in go.nvim test pipeline  https://github.com/ray-x/go.nvim/actions/runs/3309897836/jobs/5463533673
Only happend for latest but not for 0.7.2.
I set `shada=NONE` to bypass the shada.

I haven't seen it happen to me since...may just be something file system related or package manager related not cleaning up what it should?

I think an important question should be: `Should nvim handle this through behaviour _____ on fail?`

I am not sure of the purpose of these files or what causes the failures (not backwards compatible with new versions?).
Should the behavior either be delete the file on failure, load without, or delete the files on update/install?
I am not well enough informed on these files to make an assessment/statement for what default should be or how this should be handled.
At least there should be an error message or something describing which file(s) failed and the action the user should/could take or something in the doc for instances like this. This issue is good enough for most people to find it and figure it out, but we could be a little more user friendly, maybe compile things like this in neovim help/error pages or wikis somewhere.

Thoughts?

> For anyone coming across this thread who removed `~/.local/share/nvim/shada` and still got this error message, I found that I also had shada files in `~/.local/state/nvim/shada`. Removing those files got rid of the error messages.

just happened on my `NVIM v0.9.0-dev-484+gb5edea655` but this saves the day

> I had three files in ~/.local/share/nvim/shada:
> 
> * main.shada
> * main.shada.tmp.a
> * main.shada.tmp.b

I deleted them and solved!

I get this error even though the directory `~/.local/share/nvim/shada/` doesn't exist on my system (macOS for reference.)
EDIT: See @hallettj's [comment](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/6875#issuecomment-1263970879).
I had to delete `~/.local/state/nvim/shada/main.shada`

> For anyone coming across this thread who removed `~/.local/share/nvim/shada` and still got this error message, I found that I also had shada files in `~/.local/state/nvim/shada`. Removing those files got rid of the error messages.

It works ! Orz
But `main.shada` shows my neovim version==0.4.x, but my neovim version==0.9.x    
I dont know what happened. That's weird...

> .local/share/nvim/shada/main.shada
Thanks you @hallettj 
Deleting $HOME/.local/state/nvim/shada solution worked.

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

title: E576: Error while reading ShaDa file: there is an item at position 270498 that must not be there: Missing itemsare for internal uses only
